intro: Monnina brachystachya, commonly known as narrow-stemmed bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides.
